comment.text: Implicated in commitment to and/or differentiation of the myocardial lineage. Acts as a transcriptional activator of ANF in cooperation with GATA4 (By similarity). Binds to the core DNA motif of NPPA promoter (PubMed:22849347, PubMed:26926761). It is transcriptionally controlled by PBX1 and acts as a transcriptional repressor of CDKN2B (By similarity). It is required for spleen development.

Homodimer (via the homeobox); binds DNA as homodimer (PubMed:22849347). Interacts (via the homeobox) with TBX5 (via the T-box); this complex binds DNA (PubMed:26926761). Interacts with HIPK1 and HIPK2, but not HIPK3. Interacts with the C-terminal zinc finger of GATA4 through its homeobox domain. Also interacts with JARID2 which represses its ability to activate transcription of ANF. Interacts with FBLIM1. Interacts with TBX18 (By similarity).
The homeobox domain binds to double-stranded DNA (PubMed:22849347).

disease.name: Atrial septal defect 7, with or without atrioventricular conduction defects
disease.description: A congenital heart malformation characterized by incomplete closure of the wall between the atria resulting in blood flow from the left to the right atria, and atrioventricular conduction defects in some cases.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Tetralogy of Fallot
disease.description: A congenital heart anomaly which consists of pulmonary stenosis, ventricular septal defect, dextroposition of the aorta (aorta is on the right side instead of the left) and hypertrophy of the right ventricle. In this condition, blood from both ventricles (oxygen-rich and oxygen-poor) is pumped into the body often causing cyanosis.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Conotruncal heart malformations
disease.description: A group of congenital heart defects involving the outflow tracts. Examples include truncus arteriosus communis, double-outlet right ventricle and transposition of great arteries. Truncus arteriosus communis is characterized by a single outflow tract instead of a separate aorta and pulmonary artery. In transposition of the great arteries, the aorta arises from the right ventricle and the pulmonary artery from the left ventricle. In double outlet of the right ventricle, both the pulmonary artery and aorta arise from the right ventricle.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Hypothyroidism, congenital, non-goitrous, 5
disease.description: A non-autoimmune condition characterized by resistance to thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) leading to increased levels of plasma TSH and low levels of thyroid hormone. CHNG5 presents variable severity depending on the completeness of the defect. Most patients are euthyroid and asymptomatic, with a normal sized thyroid gland. Only a subset of patients develop hypothyroidism and present a hypoplastic thyroid gland.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Ventricular septal defect 3
disease.description: A common form of congenital cardiovascular anomaly that may occur alone or in combination with other cardiac malformations. It can affect any portion of the ventricular septum, resulting in abnormal communications between the two lower chambers of the heart. Classification is based on location of the communication, such as perimembranous, inlet, outlet (infundibular), central muscular, marginal muscular, or apical muscular defect. Large defects that go unrepaired may give rise to cardiac enlargement, congestive heart failure, pulmonary hypertension, Eisenmenger's syndrome, delayed fetal brain development, arrhythmias, and even sudden cardiac death.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Hypoplastic left heart syndrome 2
disease.description: A syndrome due to defective development of the aorta proximal to the entrance of the ductus arteriosus, and hypoplasia of the left ventricle and mitral valve. As a result of the abnormal circulation, the ductus arteriosus and foramen ovale are patent and the right atrium, right ventricle, and pulmonary artery are enlarged.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the NK-2 homeobox family.

comment.name: Atlas of Genetics and Cytogenetics in Oncology and Haematology

feature.description: In ASD7, TOF, CHNG5, HLHS2 and CTHM; unknown pathological significance; exhibits significant functional impairment with reduction of transactivation properties and dominant-negative effect; the mutant protein activity on the DIO2, TG and TPO promoters is significantly impaired; dbSNP:rs28936670.
In VSD3; significantly reduced activation of NPPA gene compared to wild-type; dbSNP:rs387906775.
In CHNG5; exhibits a significant functional impairment with reduction of transactivation properties and dominant-negative effect which was associated with reduced DNA binding; dbSNP:rs137852684.
In CHNG5; exhibits a significant functional impairment with reduction of transactivation properties and dominant-negative effect which was associated with reduced DNA binding; dbSNP:rs137852685.
In ASD7 and TOF; somatic mutation; dbSNP:rs104893902.
Found in patients with isolated congenital asplenia; unknown pathological significance; does not affect DNA binding; impairs transactivation activity; dbSNP:rs397515399.
